mrmc.core

Class DBRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • mrmc.core.DBRecord

  • public class DBRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Analyze a reader study (a single modality or a difference of 2 modalities).
    This class processes the InputFile.observerData.
    This class produces the AUC estimates, variance estimates, hypothesis test results, and components of variance.
    This class includes all the formulas to convert one variance representation to another.
    The conversion formulas are based on Gallas BD, Bandos A, Samuelson F, Wagner RF. "A Framework for random-effects ROC analsysis: Biases with the Bootstrap and other variance estimators", Commun Stat A-Theory 38(15), 2586-2603 (2009).

    Flow 1) Object DBRecordStat created in GUInterface.GUInterface(MRMC, java.awt.Container)
    -- InputFileCard.varAnalysisListener calls
    -- -- DBRecordStatFill(InputFile, DBRecord)

    Flow 2) Object DBRecordSize created in GUInterface.GUInterface(MRMC, java.awt.Container)
    -- InputFileCard.brwsButtonListener calls InputFile.ReadInputFile()

    Flow 3) Object created in RMGUInterface.SimExperiments_thread.doInBackground()
    -- RMGUInterface.SimExperiments_thread.doInBackground()
    calls SimRoeMetz.doSim(DBRecord)

    Important fields
    ----recordDesc
    ----recordTitle
    ----filename
    ----Task

    Author:
    Xin He, Ph.D,, Brandon D. Gallas, Ph.D, Rohan Pathare

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double[][] AUCs
      AUCs for each reader and modality [Nreader][2]
      double[] AUCsReaderAvg
      Reader-averaged auc for each modality
      double[][] BCK
      The BCK[4][7] (Barrett, Clarkson, and Kupinski) variance components
      ----BCK[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
      ----BCK[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
      ----BCK[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
      ----BCK[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
      ----BCK[i][0 thru 6] correspond to the following components
      -------- 1/N0, 1/N1, 1/N0/N1, 1/Nr, 1/N0/Nr, 1/N1/Nr, 1/N0/N1/Nr
      ----Clarkson2006_Acad-Radiol_v13p1410
      ----Gallas2009_Commun-Stat-A-Theor_v38p2586
      double[][] BCKbias
      The BCK[4][7] (Barrett, Clarkson, and Kupinski) variance components
      ----BCK[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
      ----BCK[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
      ----BCK[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
      ----BCK[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
      ----BCK[i][0 thru 6] correspond to the following components
      -------- 1/N0, 1/N1, 1/N0/N1, 1/Nr, 1/N0/Nr, 1/N1/Nr, 1/N0/N1/Nr
      ----Clarkson2006_Acad-Radiol_v13p1410
      ----Gallas2009_Commun-Stat-A-Theor_v38p2586

      The number of readers, normal cases, and diseased cases
      double[][] OR
      The OR[4][6] (Obuchowski and Rockette) variance components
      ----OR[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
      ----OR[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
      ----OR[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
      ----OR[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
      ----OR[i][0 thru 5] correspond to the following components
      -------- R, TR, Cov1, Cov2, Cov3, Error
      ----Obuchowski1995_Commun-Stat-Simulat_v24p285
      ----Hillis2014_Stat-Med_v33p330

      Flow 1) Called from InputFileCard.varAnalysisListener

      Flow 2) Called from SimRoeMetz.doSim(DBRecord)

      Creates CovMRMC
      The required InputFile Fields are
      -- InputFile.observerData
      -- InputFile.Nnormal
      -- InputFile.Ndisease
      -- InputFile.Nreader

      There is another function that creates the coefficients assuming a fully-crossed study design.

      Determines the coefficient matrix for BDG variance components given a fully crossed study design [4][8].

      Determines the coefficient matrix for DBM variance components given a fully crossed study design [4][6]

        public double[][] BDG
        The BDG[4][8] (Barrett, Clarkson, and Kupinski) variance components
        ----BDG[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
        ----BDG[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
        ----BDG[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
        ----BDG[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
        ----BDG[i][0 thru 7] refer to the following
        ----Clarkson2006_Acad-Radiol_v13p1410
        ----Gallas2009_Commun-Stat-A-Theor_v38p2586

      • DBMbias

        public double[][] DBMbias
        The DBM[4][6] (Dorfman, Berbaum, and Metz) variance components. ----DBM[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
        ----DBM[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
        ----DBM[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
        ----DBM[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
        ----DBM[i][0 thru 5] correspond to the following components
        -------- R, C, RC, TR, TC, TRC
        Perhaps it would be better to refer to these as the RM (Roe and Metz) variance components.
        ----RM solidified the model
        ----DBM presented an estimation method
        ----
        ----Dorfman1992_Invest-Radiol_v27p723
        ----Roe1997_Acad-Radiol_v4p587

      • DBM

        public double[][] DBM
        The DBM[4][6] (Dorfman, Berbaum, and Metz) variance components. ----DBM[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
        ----DBM[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
        ----DBM[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
        ----DBM[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
        ----DBM[i][0 thru 5] correspond to the following components
        -------- R, C, RC, TR, TC, TRC
        Perhaps it would be better to refer to these as the RM (Roe and Metz) variance components.
        ----RM solidified the model
        ----DBM presented an estimation method
        ----
        ----Dorfman1992_Invest-Radiol_v27p723
        ----Roe1997_Acad-Radiol_v4p587

        ----DBM[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B

        ----OR[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
        ----OR[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
        ----OR[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
        ----OR[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
        ----OR[i][0 thru 5] correspond to the following components
        -------- R, TR, Cov1, Cov2, Cov3, Error
        ----Obuchowski1995_Commun-Stat-Simulat_v24p285
        ----Hillis2014_Stat-Med_v33p330

      • ORcoeff

        public double[][] ORcoeff
        The OR[4][6] (Obuchowski and Rockette) variance components
        ----OR[0] are the components of variance of AUC_A
        ----OR[1] are the components of variance of AUC_B
        ----OR[2] are the components of the covariance between AUC_A & AUC_B
        ----OR[3] are the components of variance of AUC_A - AUC_B
        ----OR[i][0 thru 5] correspond to the following components
        -------- R, TR, Cov1, Cov2, Cov3, Error
        ----Obuchowski1995_Commun-Stat-Simulat_v24p285
        ----Hillis2014_Stat-Med_v33p330

        java.lang.String[] componentStrings,
        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> desc,
        java.lang.String AUCstr)
        Constructor for creating a record from the internal database
        Parameters:
        fname - Filename of the database file
        componentStrings - Array of strings containing component information
        desc - Contents of .omrmc file, summary stats from reader study
        AUCstr - AUCs in string form

      • DBRecord

        public DBRecord(double[][] components,
        int whichComp,
        long n,
        long n2,
        long n3,
        double[] auc)
        Constructor for creating a record from manual input of components of variance
        Parameters:
        components - Components of variance entered from GUI
        whichComp - Specifies with decomposition of components are entered
        n - Number of readers
        n2 - Number of normal cases
        n3 - Number of disease cases
        auc - The reader-averaged auc for each modality

        Analyze InputFile.observerData
        Flow 1) Called from InputFileCard.varAnalysisListener

        Flow 2) Called from SimRoeMetz.doSim(DBRecord)

        -- InputFile.Nnormal
        -- InputFile.Ndisease
        -- InputFile.Nreader

      • genBDGCoeff

        public static double[][] genBDGCoeff(long Nreader2,
                     long Nnormal2,
                     long Ndisease2)
        Determines the coefficient matrix for BDG variance components given a fully crossed study design [4][8]. This is only executed when the components of variance are input by hand or during iRoeMetz
        Parameters:
        Nreader2 - Number of readers
        Nnormal2 - Number of normal cases
        Ndisease2 - Number of disease cases
        Returns:
        Matrix containing coefficients corresponding to BDG variance components

      • genBCKCoeff

        public static double[][] genBCKCoeff(double[][] BDGcoeff_temp)
        Determines the coefficient matrix for BCK variance components given BDGcoeff
        There is another function that creates the coefficients assuming a fully-crossed study design. The inputs in that case are the number of readers, diseased cases, and nondiseased cases
        Returns:
        Matrix containing coefficients corresponding to BCK variance [4][7] components

        public static double[][] DBM2OR(int index,
                double[][] in,
                long Nreader2,
                long Nnormal2,
                long Ndisease2)
        Transforms matrix of DBM variance components into matrix of OR variance components, or vice versa
        Parameters:
        index - Whether the in[][] parameter is DBM or OR components
        in - Matrix of DBM or OR variance components
        Nreader2 - Number of readers
        Nnormal2 - Number of normal cases
        Ndisease2 - Number of disease cases
        Returns:
        Matrix of OR or DBM variance components
